thread.title: Gawk Reverse Splits Its Stock, Clearing the Way for Acquisitions

author: cnbc.com
title: Gawk Reverse Splits Its Stock, Clearing the Way for Acquisitions
text:
LOS ANGELES, CA, April 18, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- GAWK (OTC PINK: GAWKD): Scott Kettle, CEO of GAWK, Inc. announced today that the Company has reverse split its stock at 2,500 for one.
Kettle said, “The reverse split is good for Gawk, and new financing will allow for more acquisitions and new services to be launched, which means accelerated growth for the Company.
“Gawk is seriously undervalued. We have grown by acquiring companies, such as the assets of Net D, Xtelus LLC, and Connexum, LLC, buying elements of competing companies that offer us talented personnel, complimentary services and customer increases. We are doing Due Diligence on several companies in the U.S.at the moment. Prior to the action we have just taken, we have recently added services such as Voice Broadcast, Ringless Voicemail, and email advertising to brands and advertising agencies to produce more revenue. Our business plan is driven by acquisitions and organic growth. Our mission is “The Engine that Drives Sales and Marketing” for our customers.”
About GAWK, Inc.
GAWK, Inc. offers a suite of cloud communications, cloud connectivity, cloud computing, and managed cloud-based applications solutions to small, medium, and large businesses; and offers domestic and international voice services to communications carriers worldwide. It offers a suite of advanced data center and cloud-based services, including fault tolerant, high availability cloud servers, which comprise platform as a service, infrastructure as a service, and a content delivery network; managed network services that converge voice and data applications, structured cabling, wireless, and security services, as well as include Internet access via Ethernet or fiber at speeds ranging from 10 Mbps to 10 Gbps; and data center solutions, including cloud services, colocation services, and business continuity services, such as storage and security. www.gawk.com
